ee1cb8986c0c.description: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same about us, wonder about what is different & embrace one another anyway without condition.
ee1cb8986c0c.name: This Glorious Mess

header.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
header.title: This Glorious Mess

ee1cb8986c0c.shortDescription: We write down our mess, that we may marvel in what is same…

collectionHeaderMetadata.description: Exploring & Celebrating What it Means to be Human. Together.
collectionHeaderMetadata.title: This Glorious Mess

paragraphs.text: I am so fucking tired of this misogyny, of people trying to “fix” me, to change me. I am not perfect, but neither do I need fixing. If, as they say, I give up everything, my confidence, my personality, my job, my aims, my desires — if I give everything up, everything I am; just for the chance to be with someone; isn’t that suicide? And a relationship where I am just a dead body, is it worth it?
paragraphs.name: b1a7

paragraphs.text: I am so fucking tired of this misogyny, of people trying to “fix” me, to change me. I am not perfect, but neither do I need fixing. If, as they say, I give up everything, my confidence, my personality, my job, my aims, my desires — if I give everything up, everything I am; just for the chance to be with someone; isn’t that suicide? And a relationship where I am just a dead body, is it worth it?
paragraphs.name: b1a7

paragraphs.text: I have also gone on arranged blind dates and to date (pun unintended), not one has worked. One guy I met, said that I should quit my job because he was earning enough — even though and maybe because I was earning about thrice his salary. Another guy tried to tell me that I was sure to like him because, he had seen my photo and he liked me — after just a goddamn photo and a phone call where I found very little to talk to him about.
paragraphs.name: fadc
07e3
paragraphs.text: Of Compromises, Methods to “Fix” Me, Misogyny

And so it begins, the methods I must use to “fix” myself. One person said that I should get my skin bleached, so that I would be more “attractive”. Someone told me that my personality was a big minus, meaning that I was confident and assertive and that I should just listen and nod to everything. Another told me that I should lose weight and get a breast reduction, so I would be thinner and I’m at a healthy BMI. A person said that if I just quit my job, stay at home and do household chores, I could get married very quickly, because nothing is more attractive than a robot that mindlessly does chores.
To Tre, thank you for your words, your kindness, your encouragement. Thank you.
paragraphs.name: 20b4

paragraphs.text: For the first few seconds, I was dumbstruck, because I couldn’t believe anyone would say that. Then I had to laugh. He was very offended.

d2f4e77e6ef8.title: Here it is, Indira. All of it comes right back to this.

paragraphs.name: ba7f

paragraphs.text: Indira, no, ma’am. Thank you so very much for submitting this *heart work* to us. I am in love with every word. The strength of this is a solid reminder that we are who we are and if changing that to get what we may or may not want is the answer, it truly may not be worth it.
paragraphs.name: d459

paragraphs.text: This is love.
Peace~
Paint

d8ff085d277e.title: You are way ahead of most people, and you are still young, Indira.

paragraphs.text: You are way ahead of most people, and you are still young, Indira. I married at 34 and had my first child at 36 and my second at 42, when the timing (mine) was right. They are now 34 and 27 and waiting for a man they want (not need). I couldn’t applaud you louder.
compass inside me,

806e900c63a3.title: Let me tell you, you are an inspiration not just for the girls that are forced will upon by their…

paragraphs.text: Let me tell you, you are an inspiration not just for the girls that are forced will upon by their family and relatives, but also boys like me who are daring to do something very natural (it’s so natural to do what one feels right, right?), but which is mistaken as offbeat or different.
